summary: This bill, the "Standardizing Permitting and Expediting Economic Development Act" (SPEED Act), aims to amend the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (NEPA). It clarifies ambiguous provisions primarily to streamline the environmental review process for federal agency actions. Key changes include defining the scope of review, modifying procedures for determining the level of review, establishing deadlines for timely reviews, and setting standards for judicial review. The bill seeks to make environmental reviews more efficient and less time-consuming.
